author: Special Correspondent
text:
: Indian Medical Association (IMA) has started orienting small hospitals in the region on NABH (National Accreditation Board for Hospitals and Healthcare Providers) rating procedures.

Objective

With the objective of assisting hospitals to achieve international standards in patient care and safety, the IMA encouraged representatives of 170 hospitals in the region to go for NABH accreditation, IMA - Nursing Homes Board Secretary, Tamil Nadu State Branch, said. Hospitals were categorised under Health Care Organisations (more than 50 beds) and Small Health Care Organisations (less than 50 beds) for the purpose of training them on quality care based on the pre-accreditation entry level standards developed by NABH. Patient-centered standards constitute access, assessment and continuity of care; care of patients; management of medication; patient rights and education; hospital infection control; organisation Centered standards; continuous quality improvement; responsibilities of management; facility management and safety; human resource management; and information management system.
title: IMA creates awareness on NABH rating
